column1: Underking was a special appointed office of the Rohirrim in which the officer was entitled to act as if he were the king.  In wartime
column2: if the Kings of Rohan was absent from home while commanding an army
column3: the Underking ruled in his place.  Alternatively
column4: the office holder served as the field commander of the army if the King remained at home.  However
column5: in war an old King was not supposed to send his Heir to battle beyond the realm unless he had at least one other son.  During peace an Underking could be appointed only when a sick or aged King deputed his authority
column6: and the holder of the position was then considered the Heir to the throne.
